DataElement.preferredName: Villous Adenoma Finding Lesion Shape Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator that represents the shape of the villous adenoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An epithelial neoplasm morphologically characterized by the presence of a villous architectural pattern. Most often it occurs in the large intestine, small intestine, and the stomach in which the neoplastic epithelial cells show dysplastic features. It may also arise in the urinary bladder, urethra, and vagina._Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An epithelial neoplasm morphologically characterized by the presence of a villous architectural pattern. Most often it occurs in the large intestine, small intestine, and the stomach in which the neoplastic epithelial cells show dysplastic features. It may also arise in the urinary bladder, urethra, and vagina.

Concepts.definition: An adenoma arising from the glandular epithelium of the gastrointestinal tract. It is characterized by the presence of a villous architectural pattern. Most often it occurs in the large intestine, small intestine, and the stomach. The neoplastic epithelial cells show dysplastic features.

Property.preferredDefinition: Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having a narrow part by which some larger part is attached.

Concepts.definition: A lesion connected to the underlying tissue by a small stalk.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Attached directly by the base; not having an intervening stalk.

Concepts.definition: Attached directly by the base; not having an intervening stalk.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:The spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
